Interface ec.id.CapabilityRequestHandler

Implementing Classes:
PalaceECIDHandler, Handler
public abstract interface CapabilityRequestHandler
CapabilityRequestHandlers are registered with the identity owner, to be called back when an appropriate request is received. When the identity owner gets a request for a capability it looks up the appropriate CapabilityRequestHandler in its handler table.

Author:
Scott B. Lewis, slewis@communities.com
See Also:
IdentityOwner

Method Summary
Object handleRequestForCapability(ReachableID requestor, String requestName, Object requestData, Object receipt)
          Capability request hander interface.
 

Method Detail

handleRequestForCapability

public Object handleRequestForCapability(ReachableID requestor,
                                         String requestName,
                                         Object requestData,
                                         Object receipt)
                                           throws IdentityException
Capability request hander interface. Implementers of this interface can be considered by the IdentityOwner as potential handlers for a capability request. The request is identified by the requestName parameter in this call.

If the implementer of this interface wishes, it may return an Object (the capability) that is the response to the given request. If an Object is synchronously returned from this call, then it will be synchronously provided back to the requester via a call to IdentityOwner.sendCapabilityToIdentity.

If the implementer of this interface wishes, it may also return null from this call...in that case it must take responsibility for calling the IdentityOwner.sendCapabilityToIdentity method asynchronously in order to complete the capability exchange.

NOTE: This method is called synchonously by the IdentityOwner when a capability request arrives. If the handler of this call wishes to asynchronously invoke some other operation then it is up to the implementer to make the asynchronous invokation.

Parameters:
requestor - the ReachableID of the requestor
requestName - the String identifying the request
requestData - an arbitrary Object associated with the request
receipt - the receipt object that accompanies this request
Returns:
Object that is the capability granted in response to this request. May be null. If the result is null, and this handler wishes to actually send an asynchronous response to this request, then it is up to this handler to invoke the IdentityOwner.sendCapabilityToIdentity method asynchronously to actually send a response to this request.
